definition: to capture/to restrain/to constrain/to adhere rigidly to/inflexible
to bind/bunch/bundle/classifier for bunches, bundles, beams of light etc/to control

sentences.english: Confined to a stale, ill-at-ease room.
sentences.chinese: 囿于一个陈旧的，拘束的空间。

sentences.english: Modern toilet sanitation is better, the position is so coltish .
sentences.chinese: 现代化厕所卫生较好，所以位置不受拘束。

sentences.english: By this time Emil had lost all his timidity .
sentences.chinese: 这时，爱弥儿变得一点也不拘束了。

sentences.english: Methods The liver injury model was established under restraint stress for 12h in mice.
sentences.chinese: 方法采用拘束负荷方法引起小鼠应激性肝损伤模型。

sentences.english: There is little restraint in the press area as well.
sentences.chinese: 在新闻发布区，人们也不再拘束。

sentences.english: Any Act travelling beyond the scope thus set for the corporation's activities would be invalid, and not binding on the corporation.
sentences.chinese: 任何行为超出公司范围的都无效，而对法人无拘束力。

sentences.english: The river water can rush unrestrainedly.
sentences.chinese: 河水可以无拘束地奔流了。

sentences.english: In his Times piece, Buffett felt free to speak for his fellow rich.
sentences.chinese: 在纽约时报上，巴菲特毫不拘束地代表富人们讲话。

sentences.english: A binding contract is thereupon concluded.
sentences.chinese: 具有拘束力的合同就此便告缔结。

sentences.english: I have always been fascinated by corsets and my husband, Duncan, is frightfully keen on restraint.
sentences.chinese: 我和我的丈夫邓肯都为束衣着迷，酷爱拘束。

sentences.english: The age of paper money brought with it an increasingly uninhibited style of doing business.
sentences.chinese: 伴随纸币时代而来的是越来越无拘束的商业活动方式。

sentences.english: The Hippies believed in free love and self expression.
sentences.chinese: 嘻皮们相信无拘束的爱及自我表现。

sentences.english: Such decision shall be final and binding on the Parties.
sentences.chinese: 该裁判属终局裁判，对缔约双方均有拘束力。

sentences.english: "Please make yourself at home," said Nasreddin.
Judicial recognition rights may bind in cases due to excising stare decisis.
sentences.chinese: 先例规则使司法承认的权利在个案中具有拘束力。

sentences.english: And the people around you to talk to non-binding.
sentences.chinese: 与你周围的人们无拘束地交谈。

definition: free and unconstrained (idiom); unfettered/unbuttoned/without care or worries
to follow one's heart's desires/to do as one pleases (idiom)
affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
fixed framework (idiom); restriction of social conventions and taboos (usually derogatory)/regulations and restrictions
